column5: Alright I am heading down to the niagara area this weekend and I would like to have access to a canoe does anyone know where I could rent one, it would need to be within the St. Catherines, Welland, niagara area, we can't drive very far with it.
Hope you can paddle fast or a good anchor LOL.
Try Outdoors Oriented They are in St Catharines near Vansickle and 4th Ave.  Dan
Do you know any natives that live in the area.....most I know drowned while canoeing in the Niagara River.....  Seriously.......where are you intending to use this canoe ? ? ?
no, I'm not doing the niagara river if that's what you meant, and for the record ya, I can paddle that fast! I'm doing the welland canals.
Ya, I looked at them, what they say on their website leads me to believe is that I can only rent if I'm going to buy a new boat or am I wrong?
Any other options? I emailed outdoors oriented and they said their rental season doesn't start until may.
Are you saying you are canoeing the locks and connecting canal?
Another option? Buy a cheap sportspal for $200 and you'll be in business no matter where you go.
Then if you no longer want to use it.....you can sell it for 250 dollars...lol.
Got my 12 footer for $50, fixed it a bit, sold it for $75 and then bought a 14 footer for $200. They're out there!
I'm guessing he'll be fishing around Welland.
Ya, welland area I might even buying a used one but I just bought a brand new scott and it's still being built, anyplace in hamilton I could get one?
I emailed them and they have rentals!  thanks Gerritt!
I would of lent you my 16' canoe for just a cash safety deposit, but I am currently working on mine. Glad you found a place that rents them.
I'm glad you found a canoe, but I don't think you should use "Niagara" and "canoe" in the same sentence!
Maybe, but it got your attention didn't it?
